abstracts.cdata!:
The Irrigation Rehabilitation Project
            aims to increase the productivity of irrigated agriculture
            in the project area through improved water supply and will
            constitute a six year program for irrigation rehabilitation.
            With regard to direct effects the mitigation program will
            particularly focus at the mitigation of poor construction
            practices. The designs will include the designs of properly
            landscaped silt deposits and the contractors for
            construction works will be obliged to remove all equipment
            and un-used construction materials after the works.
            Undesirably high levels of groundwater will be partially
            mitigated by improving drainage in some areas, which will
            also benefit health problems resulting from increased
            humidity in houses. Beyond that, this project is the first
            step in a series of projects, in which the increases in
            water use, inputs of agro-chemicals, waterlogging and
            salination, and erosion will be dealt with by the follow-up
            projects -- On-Farm Irrigation Project, Agricultural Support
            Services Project, Rural Credit Project, and the Sheep
            Project. It is recommended that all water quality and
            quantity issues will be dealt with under a comprehensive
            Integrated Water Management Action Plan identifying all
            water needs, their mutual interactions and opportunities.
